E. G. Burrows, Manager
The University of Michigan • Ann Arbor, Michigan
WUOM 91.7 me.
ANN ARBOR
WVGR 104.1 me.
GRAND RAPIDS
July 17, 1962
Mr, Harold Hill,
Hat*1 Assoc, of Educational Broadcasters
I3I46 Conn, Ave. HW
Washington 6, D.C.
Dear Harold:
Enclosed the only comments I have received so far about the Finster system.
In talking with Frymire and Underwood last week about this problem, we
agreed that actually only a small number of stations were involved, too
small to make them wag the dog, so to speak. However, if you wish to pursue
this further, Harrison’s suggestion for a poll of in-school stations should
certainly be considered. (Incidentally, I think we made real progress on the
rules and regulations manual. It’s got some revolutionary concepts buried
in it, oh so cleverly. The Board or other reviewers are going to have a
field day once we’re finished.)....No ideas yet on the grant-in-aid program.
I’m too concerned about my future employment at the moment to think of
much else. If something reasonably interesting doesn’t come along soon, I
may be out of this racket completely by this time next year.
Cordially,
E.G-. Burrows
